Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Android Unit Test on Device F# crash:  Resources NotFoundException" (#1513) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an Android Unit Test project with F# 
2. Build and run on device

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
The Unit tests will run on the device

### Actual Behavior

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "AndroidUseLatestPlatformSdk = true leads to build errors" (#1512) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody: ### Details Android Forms App created in VS Stable does not work in VS Preview or on VS for Mac Stable. The error is similar in both situations. This error can be "fixed" by setting AndroidUseLatestPlatformSdk to false on both Windows and Mac ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Download sample from [App.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/files/1877687/App.zip) 2. Open App1 in VS Preview or VS Mac Stable 3. Attempt to build 4. Once build fails, edit App1.Android.csproj 5. Change `AndroidUseLatestPlatformSdk` to `false` 6. Open and build again ### Expected Behavior App should build at step 3 ### Actual Behavior App fails to build at step 3 and succeeds at step 6 #### Mac Error /Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/Versions/5.8.1/lib/mono/xbuild/Microsoft/NuGet/Microsoft.NuGet.targets(5,5): Error: Your project is not referencing the "MonoAndroid,Version=v7.1" framework. Add a reference to "MonoAndroid,Version=v7.1" in the "frameworks" section of your project.json, and then re-run NuGet restore. (App1.Android) #### Windows Error 2>C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\Preview\Enterprise\MSBuild\Microsoft\NuGet\15.0\Microsoft.NuGet.targets(186,5): error : Your project is not referencing the "MonoAndroid,Version=v8.1" framework. Add a reference to "MonoAndroid,Version=v8.1" in the "frameworks" section of your project.json, and then re-run NuGet restore. ### Version Information #### VS Mac === Visual Studio Enterprise 2017 for Mac === Version 7.4.2 (build 12) Installation UUID: e1f78869-2e8c-4b18-b0ba-52c72492257c Runtime: Mono 5.8.1.0 (2017-10/6bf3922f3fd) (64-bit) GTK+ 2.24.23 (Raleigh theme) Package version: 508010000 === NuGet === Version: 4.3.1.4445 === .NET Core === Runtime: /usr/local/share/dotnet/dotnet Runtime Version: 2.0.5 SDK: /usr/local/share/dotnet/sdk/2.1.4/Sdks SDK Version: 2.1.4 MSBuild SDKs: /Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/Versions/5.8.1/lib/mono/msbuild/15.0/bin/Sdks === Xamarin.Profiler === Version: 1.6.1 Location: /Applications/Xamarin Profiler.app/Contents/MacOS/Xamarin Profiler === Xamarin.Android === Version: 8.2.0.16 (Visual Studio Enterprise) Android SDK: /Users/codybeyer/Library/Developer/Xamarin/android-sdk-macosx Supported Android versions: 7.1 (API level 25) SDK Tools Version: 26.1.1 SDK Platform Tools Version: 27.0.1 SDK Build Tools Version: 27.0.3 Java SDK: /usr java version "1.8.0_131" Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_131-b11) Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.131-b11, mixed mode) Android Designer EPL code available here: https://github.com/xamarin/AndroidDesigner.EPL === Apple Developer Tools === Xcode 9.3 (14154) Build 9E145 === Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Unstable framework versions are used when $(AndroidUselatestPlatformSDK)=true" (#1511) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Copy the v8.1 framework to v108.1.99

2. Edit v108.1.99\AndroidApiInfo.xml, and set `<Id/>` to "Z", set `<Level/>` to 127, set `<Version/>` to v108.1.99, and `<Stable/>` to False:

```xml
    <AndroidApiInfo>
      <Id>Z</Id>
      <Level>127</Level>
      <Name>Z Preview</Name>
      <Version>v108.1.99</Version>
      <Stable>False</Stable>
    </AndroidApiInfo>
```
3. Copy $(AndroidSdkDirectory)\platforms\android-27 to $(AndroidSdkDirectory)\platforms\android-Z.

4. Update a new or existing project so that $(TargetFrameworkVersion)=v8.0, and $(AndroidUseLatestPlatformSdk)=true

Alternatively, a recent build from master which has early P preview support can be used.

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
Using a project with a $(TargetFrameworkVersion) lower than the max stable version, and setting $(AndroidUseLatestPlatformSdk)=true, I would expect my project to build against the latest stable version that is installed. In the case mentioned above, this would be android-27 (v8.1).

### Actual Behavior
A project with a $(TargetFrameworkVersion) lower than the max stable version, and setting $(AndroidUseLatestPlatformSdk)=true builds against my fake unstable framework version, android-Z.

### Version Information
Xamarin.Android.Sdk-OSS-8.3.99.91_HEAD_33822ad.vsix

<!--
1. On macOS and within Visual Studio, select Visual Studio > About Visual Studio, then click the Show Details button, then click the Copy Information button.

2. Paste below this comment block.
-->

### Log File
http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/log-83bd0e75034940db9ae887a8f5c03d98.txt

<!--
1. On macOS and within Visual Studio:
    a. Click **Tools** > **SDK Command Prompt**.
    b. Within the launched `Terminal.app` window, run:

            adb logcat -d | pbcopy

2. Paste below this comment block
-->



<!--
Switch to the "Preview" tab to ensure your issue renders correctly.

Please add an appropriate "Area:" label in the Labels section.
-->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Check failed: found_virtual Didn't find oat method index for virtual method: android.content.pm.ResolveInfo" (#1510) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

Launch our Xamarin Android app and log in, go to the search screen (sometimes crashes on load), then go back from the search screen (sometimes crashes on exit.) It's unpredictable what on the search screen is causing the crash (very random), I tried to minimize the impacting code but it seems to be more frequent when showing the keyboard or rebinding data to a list adapter.

### Expected Behavior

App doesn't crash.

### Actual Behavior

App crashes with the following error:

04-03 17:42:40.181: A/art(9316): art/runtime/class_linker.cc:2718] Check failed: found_virtual Didn't find oat method index for virtual method: android.content.pm.ResolveInfo android.accessibilityservice.AccessibilityServiceInfo.getResolveInfo()

Reopened issue "Encountering test failure in MonoTests.System.Net.Sockets.SocketTest.AcceptBlockingStatus (monodroid_System_test)" (#1312) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Copy over the relevant test source linked below into a new Android project and attempt to run on a device with an internet connection.

https://github.com/mono/mono/blob/master/mcs/class/System/Test/System.Net.Sockets/SocketTest.cs#L166

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
Test should pass.

### Actual Behavior
Test fails with: `System.Net.Sockets.SocketException : Connection timed out`.

### Version Information
mono-2017-12
https://gist.github.com/pjcollins/43e1e192125ac5db93c1af50faaffee8

### Log File
```
02-14 14:41:22.282 10712 10729 I NUnit   : MonoTests.System.Net.Sockets.SocketTest.AcceptBlockingStatus (monodroid_System_test)
02-14 14:41:22.282 10712 10729 I NUnit   : System.Net.Sockets.SocketException : Connection timed out
02-14 14:41:22.282 10712 10729 I NUnit   :
02-14 14:41:22.282 10712 10729 I NUnit   :   at System.Net.Sockets.Socket.Connect (System.Net.EndPoint remoteEP) [0x000b6] in <18fabd7f050747018bc25451e9833036>:0
02-14 14:41:22.282 10712 10729 I NUnit   :   at MonoTests.System.Net.Sockets.SocketTest.BlockingConnect (System.Boolean block, System.Int32 port) [0x00033] in <049e9d62f5d74935bebf1e2906ae30b7>:0
02-14 14:41:22.282 10712 10729 I NUnit   :   at MonoTests.System.Net.Sockets.SocketTest.AcceptBlockingStatus () [0x00006] in <049e9d62f5d74935bebf1e2906ae30b7>:0
02-14 14:41:22.282 10712 10729 I NUnit   :   at (wrapper managed-to-native) System.Reflection.MonoMethod.InternalInvoke(System.Reflection.MonoMethod,object,object[],System.Exception&)
02-14 14:41:22.282 10712 10729 I NUnit   :   at System.Reflection.MonoMethod.Invoke (System.Object obj, System.Reflection.BindingFlags invokeAttr, System.Reflection.Binder binder, System.Object[] parameters, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture) [0x00032] in <3e87052017124b0aa0d514e8df5eadbc>:0
```

> VS bug [#594098](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/594098)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[xabuild.exe] another fix for multi-process file access" (#1507) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: d82c97c4fa2480298251ba0eeab0120b6c159749
Context: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/index?buildId=1550431

For a while, my previous changes to `xabuild.exe` seemed to be working.

It still seemed to fail sometimes after reviewing past builds on VSTS:
- `RunXABuildInParallel` test failed randomly with non-zero exit code
when running `xabuild /version`
- Any test in `Xamarin.Android.Build.Tests`

The exception is something like:

    Unhandled Exception: System.IO.IOException: The process cannot access the file 'bin\Debug\lib\xamarin.android\xbuild-frameworks\.__sys_links.txt' because it is being used by another process.

I think one more change might finally fix this. Before this change,
`xabuild.exe` was opening the `.__sys_links.txt` every time. It should
first check and see if the symbolic links already exist before opening
the file.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] Use `BlockingCollection` for Aapt logging." (#1506) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Rather than use a `lock` object we should be using a
tried and tested `BlockingCollection` to store the
log messages from `aapt`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Android] TabbedPageRenderer does not watch for changes in child page icons" (#2279) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
If you change an icon on a child page after it is shown, the icon will not update.

### Steps to Reproduce
Run Issue1898 from the Control Gallery and you'll see the Icon 

### Expected Behavior
The Icon should change when you click the button

### Actual Behavior
The Icon does not change. The title changes but the icon does not

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.1.0.356465
- Last known good version: This issue was originally created for iOS (where it's working) not sure if it's ever worked on Android

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[iOS] ScrollToAsync not working on iOS" (#2271) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

ScrollToAsync fails to scroll to the specified Element on iOS.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open the ControlGallery
2. Navigate to test case 36651
3. Tap "Add Item"

### Expected Behavior

The ScrollView scrolls down far enough to display the last item in the list.

### Actual Behavior

The ScrollView maintains its current position.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.0.0
- Last known good version: unknown

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Invalid Siri Support After Uploading to AppStore" (#3862) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create iOS app
2. Create Intents app for Siri
3. Add AppIntentVocabulary.plist as per https://docs.microsoft.com/en-gb/xamarin/ios/platform/sirikit/implementing-sirikit?tabs=vsmac
4. Upload to the apple store

### Expected Behavior
App is uploaded successfully
### Actual Behavior
Receive an email from apple, 
"Invalid Siri Support - No example phrase was provided for INSearchForAccountsIntent in the "en" language. Please refer to "https://developer.apple.com/documentation/sirikit/registering_custom_vocabulary_with_sirikit/global_vocabulary_reference/intent_phrases""

I believe  this is due to the lack to localisation I've seen examples of how to do it when in a xcode project but I don't believe Xamarin has this ability.
### Environment

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[XI] MethodInfoTest.GetMethodBody (mscorlib test) failure on tvOS device" (#3874) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Update System to Xamarin.iOS, 966a6364, XI 11.9.2.25.pkg
2. Execute mscorlib test on tvOS device

### Expected Behavior
All tests should pass

### Actual Behavior
[FAIL] MethodInfoTest.GetMethodBody :   #3-2
  Expected: True
  But was:  False

### Environment
```
Mono                           5.10.1.31 
Visual Studio for Mac          7.5.0.1048
Xamarin.iOS                    11.9.2.25 

```

### Build Logs
Build Log: http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-11c692125a094a248a65979a7e29e995.txt

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Switching the Viewing throws "Object reference not set" " (#3863) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create new iOS project
2. Open Main.storyboard
3. Switch Viewing from iPhone to iPad

### Expected Behavior
The viewing is changed. VSM continues working.
### Actual Behavior
"Fatal error has occurred" message appears.
